column4: I can't change the permissions for these files on my usb drive. I can change them if i copy them to my hard drive but when i copy them back they go back to "Allow executing this file as a program"
I can't remember if its FAT or NTFS
what fs you use on the usb drive?
ok
FAT16
FAT does not have permissions. Writing to NTFS is a bit more complicated.
what do you mean by more complicated?
The fs is not open and MS has a lot of hidden api.
Application Programming Interface?
yes.
so does NTFS allow permissions?
It does
cool. i would just make it ext2 but i use linux and windows
thanks kjele
Best to keep it as fat and then chmod if you need to
how do i remove executable with chmod?
its just the arguement i don't know
there needs to be something in between chmod and 'file'
!chmod | no-name_
Even if you remove executable you can still execute the file.
